title: SQL ServerUPPER()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerUPPER()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Convert the text to upper-case:
SELECT UPPER('SQL Tutorial is FUN!');

Definition and Usage
The UPPER() function converts a string to upper-case.
Note:
Also look at the
LOWER()
function.
Syntax
UPPER(
text
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
text
Required. The string to convert
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Convert the text in "CustomerName" to upper-case:
SELECT UPPER(CustomerName) AS UppercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT UPPER(CustomerName) AS UppercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerUPPER()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerUPPER()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerUPPER()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
